Antony is 43 years old, married and supports a family of five people. He has done a hawking business for a variety of home care merchandise for the last eight years earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to use to set up business premises. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. 

His future dream is to improve his financial stability and own a pickup transport business.

loans.use: to set up business premises.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 41-year-old married woman and a resident of Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. She has 7 children ages 4-19. She has been in the business of fishing  for fourteen years now. Her husband is a fisherman and she works hard to help support the family. The business is not always good, especially if the weather is not conducive to fishing, like if there is typhoon and storm, but they persevere for their family’s sake.  She is asking for a loan of 8000 PHP to buy a new fish net.

Marilyn  hopes that she could expand her ventures and earn a bigger income so she can provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: to buy a new fish net.

loans.name: Rahmatjon

texts.ru: Рахматджон обратился в нашу организацию за финансовой поддержкой так как нуждается а корме для скота.   Он  отец 5 детей.    Всю свою жизнь он занимается откормом скота так как не имеет образования.   Его сыновья помогают в разведении скота.    Сейчас у него много коров, но денег на корм не хватает, чтобы до весны прокормить свой скот поэтому планирует закупить корм.  Это единственный доход в семье поэтому он хочет развивать свой бизнес. Рахматчон мечтает обучить своих детей чтобы они получили образование и работали по профессии.   Он очень надеется на финансовую поддержку от организации Арванд.
texts.en:
Rahmatjon has contacted our organization for financial support as he needs to buy feed for his livestock.  

He is the father of five children.  He has never attended school and has been involved in the fattening of livestock all his life.  His sons help him to raise livestock.  

He now has a lot of cows, but he doesn't have enough money to feed them until the spring, which is why he is planning to buy some feed.  Since Rahmatjon's business is his family's only source of income, he would like to expand his activity. 

His dream is to send his sons to school so that they get an education and have good jobs. 

He looks very forward to receiving financial support from MDO Arvand.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed.

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Kanou ont en moyenne  42 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  Tamaro, un des villages relevant de la  commune de San.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  les céréales, les articles de boutiques (lait, sucre, thé etc.)  et les fruits et légumes.
Après avoir correctement remboursés le 1er prêt, les femmes du groupe Kanou sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. Minata Lamine, 2 eme personne debout sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite,  compte utiliser pour acheter, 1 bidon d’huile alimentaire, des poivres, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines, des paniers de grains de céréales et quelques  paniers de fruits et légumes. 
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de San et effectue ses ventes, dans mon village  de Tamaro, à domicile et la foire hebdomadaire, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women who compose the KANOU group are, on average, 42 years old with six children each.  They all live in extended traditional families in Tamaro, one of the villages of the commune of San.  

They know each other through family ties and they sell food products and grocery items such as condiments for cooking, grains, fruits and vegetables, milk, sugar, tea etc. 

They have duly repaid their first loan and are now taking their second solidarity loan.  

Minata Lamine (second from the left in the photo) is planning to use her loan to buy one can of cooking oil, some peppers, fresh tomatoes, onions, eggplants, baskets of grains and a few baskets of fruits and vegetables.

She buys her supplies at the Grand Market in San and resells her goods in her own village of Tamaro, from her home and at the weekly market.  She sells for cash and sometimes on credit to a retail group of customers consisting of men and women.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, which will be used in part to buy food and cover healthcare costs and school fees, while the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady est une femmes mariée qui vit avec son époux et ses quatre enfants.L'activité principale dans sa localité est l'agriculture.Ainsi , elle exploite pour son propre compte une parcelle de terre sur laquelle elle cultive différentes variétés de melon.Une fois sa production vendue, elle prend en charge les dépenses d'entretien de ses enfants ainsi que ses propres besoins.Elle sollicite un pret de 250 000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais.
texts.en: Khady is a married woman, who lives with her husband and their four children. The main activity in her region is agriculture. As a result, she farms for her own account a piece of land where she grows different varieties of melon. Once her crop is sold, she is able to cover her childcare costs and her own basic needs. She is seeking a loan of 250,000f in order to purchase seed and fertiliser.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertiliser.

loans.name: Kelle Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de deux femmes fait partie du Banc Villageois Kelle, créé le 30 décembre 2009. Elles habitent le même village et sont en bonne entente.

Rokhaya, la présidente du groupe est une femme de 38 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 filles et 01 garçon. Elle fait du petit commerce de légumes. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 03 ans. Elle tient aussi une boutique d'alimentation générale dans le village. Sur la photo, elle est habillée en bleu et a levé la main gauche.

Avec son prêt elle voudrai acheter 03 sacs de choux,02 de patates, 03 de maniocs, 01 d’aubergines, gombo et sucre, 20 litres d'huile.

Avec ses bénéfices elle a la charge de la famille(nourriture, scolarité et santé).
texts.en:
The group Kelle consists of two members and is part of the local Banc Villageois, created on December 30, 2009. The two women live in the same village and get along well. 

Rokhaya, age 38, is the president of the group. She is the lady wearing blue and raising her left hand. She is a divorced mother of four children, 3 girls and a boy. She has been selling vegetables for over 3 years, and she also runs a general food store in the village. 

She will use her loan to buy three bags of cabbage, two sacks of potatoes, three bags of cassava root, one bag of eggplants, some gumbo, some sugar, and 20 liters of oil. 

She will use her profits to provide for her family (food, tuition and healthcare).

loans.use: to buy vegetables and merchandise for her food store.

loans.name: Fatoumata Mallé

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Mallé une veuve de 44 ans vit avec ses 8 enfants, dont l’ainé a 17 ans et le plus jeune, 2 ans. Elle est une brave femme car depuis 7 ans maintenant, elle travaille pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants . Elle n’a jamais eu de crédit au niveau de l’IMCEC et vient solliciter 200000F CFA afin d’acheter de l’arachide et du mil et de le revendre dans le marché local. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à13h.
 Avec les enfants, il faut toujours être à leurs petits soins : habillements, scolarité, argent de poche pour les petits besoins au quotidien.
Etant soutien de famille, elle a besoin d’augmenter son fond de commerce pour améliorer ses ventes et maximiser son profit afin d’arriver toujours à satisfaire ses enfants bien que c’est très dure d’y arriver.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Mallé is a 44-year-old widow who lives with her eight children, ages 2 to 17 years old.  She is a very courageous woman who has been working to provide for her family for the past seven years.

She has never before taken a loan with UIMCEC, and she is now requesting 200,000 CFA francs to buy groundnut and millet which she will resell at the local market.  She works from 8 o'clock in the morning until 1 o'clock in the afternoon.

She is always trying to meet the needs of her children: she has to buy clothes, pay school fees, provide pocket money for small daily needs...
As the family provider, Fatoumata Mallé needs to boost her business in order to increase her sales and maximize her profits.  Although she is finding this very difficult, her goal is to always satisfy the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy groundnut and millet for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Irene will use the loan to buy more stock of new clothes for sale in the coming high season. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand the business and open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more stock of new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Makane

texts.fr:
Makane  est un jeune qui est très tôt entré dans le commerce. Il a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Makane dispose d’un atelier de couture ou il fait de la coupe et confection d’habits pour homme et femme. Avec  son activité, il a besoin d’acheter de la garniture pour toute coupe, c’est pourquoi, il a pensé investir aussi dans la mercerie tout dans le même  atelier. Avec  le crédit de 300000F CFA, il va acheter des marchandises de mercerie : fil, renfort, fermeture, garniture, boutons…
Makane appuie à la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Il a comme ambition d’équiper son atelier pour qu’il soit plus attrayant.
texts.en:
Makane is a young man, who started his business very early. He already has ten years of experience. He is married and the father of a family. Makane owns a tailoring workshop, where he makes clothes for men and women. For his workshop, he needs to buy trim for each item of clothing, which is why he thought of also investing in sewing supply sales in the same workshop. With the loan of 300,000 FCFA, he is ging to buy sewing supplies to sell: thread, lining material, zippers, trim, buttons...

Makane supports the daily expenses of his family. His ambition is to equip his workshop and make it more attractive.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies: thread, lining material, zippers, trim, buttons

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est crée le 21 décembre 2009. Les membres le composant entretiennent de bonnes relations , leur principale activité est le petit commerce.

Debout à droite de la photo, Aminata la vedette est âgée 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 01 garçons et 03 filles. 

Son prêt reçu , elle achète des seaux de pâte d'arachide à 8 000 frs l'unité de 20 kgs dans les marchés hebdomadaires  pour revendre à 15 000 frs. Elle achète également 02 sacs de détergent à 8 000 frs l'un et les revendre à 12 000 frs l'unité.

Avec les bénéfices elle subvient à ses besoins et soutient son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Le bv was created on December 21, 2009.  The members enjoy good relationships and they are mainly involved in small businesses. 

Standing to the right in the photo, Aminata, the youngest, is 31 years old.  She is married and the mother of 4 children; one boy and three girls.

With her loan she will buy tubs of peanut butter for 8000 frs per 20 kgs at the weekly markets, to resell at 15,000 frs.  She will also buy two sacks of detergent at 8,000 frs each and resell them at 12,000 frs. 

With the profits she will be able to take care of her needs and help her husband meet family responsibilities.

loans.use: tu buy merchandise (peanut butter at retail and detergents).

loans.name: Kouchéssi Albert

texts.fr: Kouchéssi Albert est âgé de 28 ans et vit au Bénin. Kouchéssi Albert est un célibataire. Kouchéssi Albert vit seul et assure ses divers besoins. Kouchéssi Albert a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Afin d’assurer ses divers besoins, Kouchéssi Albert mène comme activité depuis sept ans, l’agriculture dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Kouchéssi Albert est un aide soignant. Kouchéssi Albert désire agrandir son activité d’agriculture par la culture d’une grande surface de maïs. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Kouchéssi Albert sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Kouchéssi Albert is 28 years old and lives in Benin. He is single and lives alone. He takes care of his own various needs. Kouchéssi Albert has attended secondary school.

In order to meet his different needs, Kouchéssi Albert has been farming in his area for 7 years. In addition to this activity, he is also a caregiver.

Kouchéssi Albert wishes to increase his farming by cultivating a large area of corn. 

In pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase turnover and his income, Kouchéssi Albert is asking, for a second time, a loan from Alidé. This loan will allow him to increase his level of farming and to earn more profits. His first loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: Acheter d'autres surfaces pour l'agriculture.

loans.name: Elisabeth Siga's Group

texts.fr:
BV créé le 13 décembre 2008 est composé par l'association des femmes catholiques qui de par leur entente et solidarité ont accepté d'ouvrir à d'autres femmes le BV.
Élisabeth, âgée de 50 ans, est veuve et mère de 6 enfants et 07 autres en charge. Elle s'occupe elle même de sa famille car n'ayant pas de soutien. Elle fait du petit commerce, vente de poissons au marché.
Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter 10 casiers de poissons cela dépend des catégories qu'on trouve sur le marché.
Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettent d'assurer la nourriture de la famille, de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants.Elle a pu aussi renforcer ses épargnes et payer ses intérêts grâces à son activité de petit commerce
texts.en:
This banc villageois, created on December 13, 2008, is a Catholic Women's Association whose members, moved by a feeling of amity and solidarity, have decided to open their group to other women.

Élisabeth, age 50, is a widow and the mother of six children with an additional seven children in her care.  She takes care of her family alone, without any support.

She is involved in retail and sells fish at the market.

Élisabeth will use her loan to buy 10 crates of fish.  The type of fish she buys depends on what is available on the market.

With the profits from her activity, Élisabeth is able to feed her family and to cover school fees for her children.  She has also been able to strengthen her savings and to pay her interest thanks to her small retail activity.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Latifou

texts.fr: Latifou vit avec sa femme revendeuse et leurs 03 enfants tous scolarisés à Lomé. Ils sont âgés de 14 à 05ans. Mr Latifou est conducteur de taxi depuis 2000. Afin d’acheter du moteur pour sa voiture, il sollicite un cinquième prêt à WAGES. Avec les profits, il veut acheter d’autres voitures neuves tout en assurant les besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Latifou lives in Lomé with his wife (a re-seller) and their three children, all of wom attend school and are aged between 5 and 14 years old. Mr Latifou has been a taxi driver since 2000. In order to purchase an engine for his car, he is asking for a fifth loan from WAGES. He hopes to use the profits to purchase additional new cars, all the while attending to the needs of his family.

loans.use: purchase an engine for his taxi

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old and is married with two children who are 5 and 7 years old. He owns a business of transporting people. He has been in this business for 2 years and he works from 5 am until 10 pm every day. 

Samuel has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase spare parts (tires, engine, mirror, etc.) for his motorcycle transport business. With his profits, he will be able to save for his future and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts (tires, engine, mirror, etc.) for his motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Gbedokpo Group

texts.fr: GBEDOKPO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Mahougnon Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Paul. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. Mahougnon Marie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Mahougnon Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de trois ans que Mahougnon Marie mène comme activité la vente de condiments et des viandes de bœufs à son domicile. Mahougnon Marie exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Mahougnon Marie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mahougnon Marie sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: GBEDOKPO is a group of three friends. The group's representative, Mahougnon Marie (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 38 years old and married to a man named Paul. The couple has two children, both of whom are in school. Mahougnon Marie lives together with her children and her husband. The couple provides for the the children's various expenses together. Mahougnon Marie did not attend school. For nearly three years, Mahougnon Marie has been working selling seasonings and beef from her home. Mahougnon Marie works passionately in this business, which allows her to provide for her needs as well as those of her children. Mahougnon Marie stocks up in a city in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers, Mahougnon Marie is asking for a fourth loan with the other members of the GBEDOKPO group. This loan will be used to better respond to the needs of their customers and to make more profits. Their previous loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy seasonings and beef skin.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi mariée à un soudeur ferrailleur, est âgée de 36ans. Elle est mère de 03 enfants dont 02 à l’école. Elle est revendeuse de profession, vend des assiettes  et fait en même temps la restauration. Afin d’agrandir son activité, et mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt.  Elle voudrait réinvestir dans l’activité et subvenir aux moindres besoins de la famille. Elle est dans ce domaine il y a 04ans.
texts.en:
Essé is married to a welder / scrap dealer and she is 36 years old.  She has three children, two of whom attend school.

Essé is a professional reseller: she sells plates and also prepares meals.  

In order to boost her activity and to better meet her customers' needs, she is requesting a first loan from WAGES.  

She would like to reinvest in her activity and meet all of her family's needs.  She has been involved in this business for the past four years.

loans.use: to buy plates and ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Carlos Yobany

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos  tiene 43 años de edad convive con sus hijos es padre soltero, Su actividad principal es la venta y siembra de café  desde hace más de 2 años.
Don Carlos esta solicitando el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: fertilizantes, abonos, compra de alimentos, pago a peones para la buena asistencia de su finca, en la comunidad donde el vive, es una persona muy trabajadora y se levanta muy temprano para atender sus actividades, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Don Carlos, le contribuirá a tener una mejor finca, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, para salir adelante.
Don Carlos sus sueños es poder mejorar su finca darle la asistencia necesaria y dejarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Septiembre 2012
texts.en:
Carlos, 43, is a single father and lives with his children.  His main activity is growing and selling coffee, and he has been in this business for two years.

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy products such as fertilizers, composts and feed, as well as hire farm workers in the community where he lives.  He is a very hard worker and gets up earlier in the morning to take care of his business.  With the help of the loan, Carlos will have a better farm and improve his income to cover household expenses and give his family a better quality of life.

Carlos' goal is to improve his farm by giving it the necessary attention so he can leave his children a good inheritance.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, composts and feed, as well as hire farm workers.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.es:
La señora Victoriana esta solicitando un préstamo que le ayudara mucho a darle protección a su casa con el enjarre y pintura. 
La señora Victoriana ha desarrollado su patrimonio junto con su esposo, la señora Victoriana trabaja en una casa particular en limpieza y su esposo trabaja como chofer de un camión de carga, tiene una hija que esta estudiando la secundaria. 
Solicitan el préstamo para mejorar el patrimonio y mejorar la calidad de vida.
La señora Vitoriana ya ha tenido crédito con KIVA el cual fue para que su hija pudiera seguir estudiando y agradeció su cooperación.
texts.en:
Victoriana is requesting a loan to help her provide more protection for her house with plaster and paint.  She and her husband have acquired their assets together.  Victoriana works in a private home as a cleaning lady and her husband drives a dump truck.  Their daughter is in junior high school.

They are requesting a loan to improve their property and quality of lfie.

Vitoriana has had another KIVA loan which she used to pay for her daughter's education, for which she was grateful.

loans.use: To finish the outside of her house.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El señor Porfirio tiene ya más de diez años con su negocio de venta de abarrotes ubicado en su domicilio. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para ampliar el espacio de su negocio ya que sus clientes le están solicitando más variedad de productos, que es verduras, frutas, carnes, lactaos y productos de papelería escolar. Solicita el crédito ya que no quiere descapitalizar el ingreso del negocio.
El señor Porfirio vive con su esposo y un hijo quienes le ayudan a tender la tienda, con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio pagara el crédito. Ya que cuenta también con una pensión y con el ingreso de su hijo de sus trabajos como electricista serán para los gastos familiares.
Desea mejorar su negocio y tener más variedad de productos y que sus clientes le puedan seguir comprando.
texts.en:
Porfirio has been in business selling groceries out of his home for ten years.  He is requesting a loan to expand the store since customers are requesting more variety of products, such as vegetables, fruit, meat, dairy products and school supplies.  He needs the loan because he does not want to decapitalize business income.

Porfirio lives with his wife and son who help out in the store.  He plans to pay back the loan with the earnings from the store.  He also has a prension and his son's income from his electrician work to pay for household expenses.

He wants to imrpove his business and stock a wider variety of products so his customers will stay loyal.

loans.use: To expand his store.

loans.name: Pocohilense Group

texts.es:
La señora Marta esta casada, tiene  40 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales estudian 2, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes y guipiles,  inicio este negocio, gracias al apoyo de su esposo y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a ser jornalero.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizaran, para la compra de hilos, y así incrementar su producción de tejidos y tener mejores ganancias. Espera en el futuro tener 2 trabajadores para tener mejor producción. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al tejido de típicos y hacen exportación de su producción.
texts.en:
Marta, 40, is married and was unable to get an education.  She has five children, two of which are in school.  She weaves traditional garments (huipiles) and started her business with the help of her husband.  She has been in business for five years.  Her husband is a wage earner.

She has organized a group to request a loan to buy yarn to increase production of woven items and improve income.  She hopes to have two workers in the future to increase production.  The other members of the group also weave typical garments and export their production.

loans.use: To buy yarn.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel de 54 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla y allí tiene un restaurante, que inició una vez decidió apoyar los gastos de su hogar, que en ese momento estaban a cargo de su cónyuge. Ella inició  desde hace 13 años, vendiendo sopas, alimento líquido, que se prepara con carne verduras, tubérculos y bulbos y se bebe caliente como parte del almuerzo; con esta idea de generación de ingresos le fue muy bien y poco a poco fue agregando otros productos, como comidas corrientes, almuerzos completos, jugos preparados con frutas naturales, como mango, níspero, guanábana, corozo, dulcería y bebidas. En la actualidad con su negocio ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos y acceder a créditos, pues ya cuenta con 16 financiamientos en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; con ellos ha logrado hacer adecuaciones locativas y mejorar su vivienda e incrementar su capital de trabajo, porque hoy su negocio está mucho mas surtido, su nivel de ventas se ha incrementado y logró formalizarlo. Su negocio,  sus compras las realiza en la central de abastos del municipio y vende de contado a los vecinos del sector. En la actualidad está solicitando su primer financiamiento a través de Kiva, para continuar incrementando su potencial de ventas, con su nuevo crédito comprará refrescos, dulcería, productos desechables y cervezas, preparándose para las fiestas venideras, época en la cual sus ventas pasan por su mejor momento.  Su meta es continuar organizando su negocio y con sus ingresos adecuar 2 apartamentos para venderlos y reinvertir, pero su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente, para cumplir totalmente con todos sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Isabel, 54, lives in the town of Malambo, a metropolitan area of the city of Barranquilla, where she has a restaurant that she decided to open to help cover the household expenses, which her husband was paying for.  She began business 13 years ago selling soup, made of meat, vegetables, tubers and bulbs, which was served as part of lunch.  Income began to come in and business started going well, so little by little she added more menu items such as regular foods, complete lunches, natural fruit juices made with mango, níspero, guanábana, corozo, and sweets and beverages.

Currently, through her business she has been able to increase her income and receive loans, 16 of which she has had through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  With the loans she has been able to make improvements at the restaurant, renovate her home and increase her working capital, because her business has much more variety.  Her sales volume has gone up and become more stable.  She buys her supplies at the town wholesale market and sells on a cash basis to neighbors.  

She is now requesting her first loan through Kiva to continue increasing her sales potential.  The new loan will be used to buy soft drinks, sweets, disposable products and beer as she prepares for the upcoming festivities which is when sales reach their peak.  Her goal is to continue organizing her business and use her income to renovate two apartments so she can sell them and reinvest her money.  Her greatest challenge is the lack of working capital, which is insufficient to meet her goal of prosperity.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sweets, disposable products and beer.

loans.name: Evenor

texts.es:
Evenor, habita en la comunidad San Jerónimo, Teustepe donde la siembra de granos básicos, es la actividad principal en esa zona. Lleva 22 años trabajando en la agricultura solo finalizo el primer grado de la primaria. Actualmente está casado, tiene 3 hijos de 10,12 y 7 años de edad, están estudiando la primaria. 
Este oficio lo aprendió por tradición pues sus padres se dedicaban a las labores agrícolas, en especial la siembra de granos básicos. Gracias a su gran esfuerzo y arduo trabajo tiene su casa y lleva el alimento a su familia.   
Él requiere el financiamiento para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sembrar frijol. Con esta inversión le dará un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos, que una vez que venda la cosecha, cancelara y continuara sembrando. Invertirá en comprar más tierra para aprovechar los suelos fértiles.
texts.en:
Evenor lives in the community of San Jerónimo, Teustepe. He grows basic grains, the main activity in this area. He has been working in farming for 22 years and only finished the first grade. NOw he is married and has three children, aged 10, 12 and 7. They go to primary school. 

He learned his trade by tradition. His parents worked as farmers, especially growing basic grains.Thanks to his hard work and effort he has a house and feeds his family.  
   
He needs the loan to buy manure and fertilizer to plant beans. With this invetsment he can maintain his crops better. Once he harvests, he will pay it off and continue to plant. He will invest in buying more land to take advantage of the fertile soil.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to plant beans.

loans.name: Beatriz Gissela

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer joven de 20 años, es soltera y tuvo la oportunidad de aprobar la escuela primaria. Vive con sus padres en el sector sur de la ciudad de Quito, capital de la República del Ecuador y es la segunda ciudad más poblada con más de 2 millones de habitantes, entre nativos y migrantes de otras ciudades y países, ha sido el punto de encuentro de habitantes de todas las provincias, y está embellecida con extensas calles, y edificios con diseños vanguardistas en donde se mueven empresas de renombre en todas las áreas. Beatriz reside en Caupicho un barrio ubicado en el sector sur de la ciudad, un sector con una alta actividad comercial que es cada vez más fortalecida y que aporta en gran manera al crecimiento económico de la ciudad. Se destaca en esta zona los parques con amplias zonas verdes en los cuales se dan cita las familias los fines de semana. Hay gran accesibilidad a todo tipo de servicios y sus habitantes son emprendedores que aprovechan cada oportunidad que se presenta con establecimiento de nuevos negocios.
Beatriz se dedica a la venta de ropa casual desde hace 2 años y en el cual invierte 6 horas al día, y se las arregla para ayudar a sus padres en casa. Trabaja sola y a pesar de que es un negocio muy competitivo, la calidad de ropa que ella ofrece favorece sus ventas, pues las personas que dan precios bajos venden ropa de calidad menor. Beatriz solicitó un préstamo para incrementar el stock de ropa que ofrece y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes quienes tienen diferentes preferencias.  Ella sueña un día tener su propia local en el que pueda ofrecer ropa para todas las edades y ocasiones y de esta forma incrementar sus ingresos para que su calidad de vida mejore.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a young 20 year old woman. She is single and was able to finish primary school. She lives with her parents in the southern part of Quito, the capital of the Republic of Ecuador. Its Ecuador's second most populated city with more than 2 million inhabitants, between natives and migrants from otehr cities and countries. It has been the meeting point for people from all the provinces and it is beautified with extensive streets and buidings with avant-garde designs where well known businesses operate in all areas. Beatriz lives in Caupicho, a neighborhood located in the southern part of the city. There is ever growing commercial activity that contributes to the city's economic growth. It is notable for its parks with ample green space where families go on the weekends. There is accesibility to all types of services and its inhabitants are enterprising and take advantage of every opportunity that comes along to establish new businesses. 

Beatriz has sold clothes for more than 2 years. She does it for 6 hours a day and manages to help her parents at home. She works alone, despite it being a very competitive business. The quality of clothes she offers helps her sales, because the people who sell at low prices sells clothing of worse quallity. Beatriz asked for a loan to increase her clothing stock and satisfy the needs of her customers who have different preferences. She dreams of having her own locale some day where she can offer clothing for all ages and occasions and in this way increase her income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing.

loans.name: Emilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Emilia, está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la costura, la compra será en telas de diferentes colores y tambien ciper, botones, ya que estos materiales los utiliza a diario para poder confeccionar uniformes escolares y ropa de vestir como pantalones, vestidos y blusas.
Considera haber tenido un efecto positivo en la inversión anterior, ya que el préstamo le permitió cubrir los gastos que en ese momento necesitaba cubrir, su demanda ha aumentado y su familia se encuentra estable.
texts.en:
Emilia is asking for a loan to invest in buying sewing materials. She will buy different colored fabrics as well as zippers and buttons, since she uses these materials daily to make school uniforms and clothing such as pants, dresses and blouses.

She considers the previous loan to have had a positive effect, since it allowed her to cover the expenses she needed to cover at that time. Her demand has increased and her family is stable.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Damaris Esther

texts.es:
Damaris, esta interesada en seguir trabajando, por eso solicita un préstamo para compra de materiales para elaborar bisutería, piedras, dijes, hilos, cadenas enchapadas, alambre, y todo lo demás necesario para que ella continúe elaborando los collares, pulseras, anillos.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, que le permitió mejorar la disponibilidad de materiales y la elaboración de bisutería, mejoro el nivel de ventas, considera tener más artículos y variedad en el inventario.
texts.en:
Damaris is interested in continuing to work which is why she is requesting a loan to buy materials for making [costume] jewelry.  She will buy stones, pendants, threads, plated chains, wire and everything else she needs to continue making necklaces, bracelets and rings.

Damaris' previous loan had a positive effect and allowed her to improve her availability of materials and her jewelry making.  She improved her sales levels and would like to have more items and variety in her inventory.

loans.use: to buy stones, pendants, threads, plated chains and wire for making jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires and new clothing such as blouses, skirts and underwear

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Roberto, necesita invertir en el cultivo de maíz y ayote, por eso solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en abono y herbicidas,  ya que los aplicara a la siembra para prevenirles las plagas y fortalecer la producción, espera tener buenos resultados de esta inversión.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, comprándose abono y herbicidas, con la producción que recibió logro vender y generar ingresos a su hogar, para ayudar a solventar algunas necesidades.
texts.en:
Roberto needs to invest in his corn and squash crops.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to invest in buying fertilizers and herbicides which he will apply to his crops to prevent pests and strengthen production.  He hopes to obtain good results from this investment.

Roberto's previous loan had a positive effect.  He bought fertilizers and herbicides.  He was able to sell his crops and make income for his household, to help cover some needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Mujeres De Confianza Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Mujeres de Confianza esta conformado por 9 integrantes, madres solteras  con 16 hijos bajo su responsabilidad, ellas corresponde al municipio del Sauce, que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país, lugar que se caracteriza ser productor de leche, queso, cuajada, crema. Las integrantes del banco comunal Mujeres de confianza son mujeres muy trabajadora, responsable, gente humilde, trabajadora del campo, se conocen mutuamente y se apoyan entre si.  Reyna Isabel es la coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga del buen funcionamiento y la responsabilidad del mismo en cuanto a los pagos en tiempo y forma. Reyna Isabel tiene por actividad económica la venta de cuajada de forma ambulante  y en su casa, tiene 10 anos de tener dicho negocio. La rutina de Reyna es de 9 horas diaria, desde  las 6: 00 am hasta  3:00 pm,  todo el día sale a recorrer su comunidad ofreciendo sus cuajadas cargando en su cabeza una pana con el producto. Reyna expresa que aunque su rutina es pesada agradece tener ese medio de vida digno para sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos. El banco comunal Mujeres de Confianza agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener medio de trabajo dignamente.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres de Confianza' community bank has nine members who are single mothers with 16 children in their care.  They live in the town of El Sauce which is located in the north of the country.  This area is known for its milk, cheese, curds and cream production.  The members of the 'Mujeres de Confianza' community bank are very hard-working, responsible women.  They are humble, agricultural workers who know each other and support each other.  

Reyna Isabel is the coordinator of this group.  She ensures its smooth running and is responsible for making sure everybody pays on time and in full.  Reyna Isabel's business is selling curds as an itinerant street vendor.  She also makes sales from home.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  Reyna works nine hours a day, from 6.00am to 3.00pm.  She goes out in her community and offers her curds for sale, loading them into a basket that she carries on her head.  Reyna says that although her routine is arduous she is grateful that she has this way of making a decent living which enables her to provide for her young children.  The 'Mujeres de Confianza' community bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua.  It allows them to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up with curds to sell

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
Jose, necesita comprarse materiales para iniciar la siembra de granos básicos, comprara semilla de maíz, 10 sacos de abono y tambien herbicidas, para esto solicita un préstamo que le permita comprarse los materiales y aplicarlos al cultivo, él espera tener buenos resultados con el uso de los insumos agrícolas.
Con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar la producción de maíz, de las cosechas ha logrado vender y que su familia tenga el sustento diario.
texts.en:
José needs to buy materials to start growing basic grains. He will buy corn seeds, ten bags of fertilizer and also herbicides. For this, he is requesting a loan that allows him to buy the materials and apply them to the crop. He expects to have good results by using agricultural supplies.

With the previous loan, he managed to improve the production of corn. He has managed to sell the harvest and to provide his family's daily livelihood.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, ten bags of fertilizer and also herbicides.

loans.name: Terimbereii Group

texts.fr:
Alexandre fait partie du groupe TerimbereII et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 40 ans et est marié à Sophie,  une  commerçante de tomates. Ensemble ils ont 9 enfants, âgés de  8 à 25 ans, tous  étudient.

Il est  commerçant de petit bétail depuis   4 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  cinq chèvres  supplémentaires; tout le bétail sera vendu, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  pratiquer l’élevage, construire une maison et que ses enfants étudient.
texts.en:
Alexandre is a member of the TerimbereII group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 40 years old and married to Sophie, a tomato-seller. The couple have 9 children aged between 8 and 25, all of whom are getting an education.

Alexandre has been selling small livestock for 4 years. This is his 3rd loan from Turame. His Kiva-sponsored loan will increase his capital and enable him to buy 5 more goats. All of his livestock will be sold, so that he can earn more. In the coming years, he would like to start breeding livestock, build a house, and ensure that his children can keep studying.

loans.use: to buy 5 more goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three pigs.

loans.name: Yuris

texts.es:
La joven Yuris, de 22 años es originaria de la comarca El Bramadero tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la agricultura, desde hace 10 años su nivel académico es básico solo finalizo la primaria, pudo seguir estudiando por la necesidad de obtener ingresos para subsistir. Ella junto con su madre y hermana se dedican a las labores de siembra. Esta actividad le ha permitido cubrir la necesidad de consumo alimenticio, poder dale educación a su hijos.
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar abono y aplicarlo en sus siembras de granos básicos. Pues entre mejor mantenimiento le de a sus cultivos mejores serán los rendimientos esperados. Una de sus metas es lograr tener su propia casa, ya que actualmente vive con su madre, pero desea tener sus propias cosas.
texts.en:
Yuris is a young woman of 22 who is from El Bramadero region.  She has a four-year-old son.  Yuris has been farming for 10 years.  She has a basic level of education as she only completed elementary school.  She was unable to continue studying because she needed to make income in order to survive.  Yuris farms together with her mother and sister.  This work has allowed her to cover her daily food needs and provide her son with an education.

Yuris took out this loan to buy fertilizers to apply to her basic grain crops because the better care she takes of her crops, the better the yield she will obtain. One of Yuris' goals is to own her own home.  She currently lives with her mother but she would like to have her own things.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to apply to her basic grains

loans.name: Bilogui

texts.fr: Bilogui est une femme célibataire âgée 53 ans qui vit dans un quartier de la capitale. Mère de 4 enfants, elle tient un petit restaurant dans un coin de la place où elle propose divers plats à ses cilents. Grâce à son talent en art culinaire elle s'est faite une clientèle grandissante qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela elle solicte un crédit qui lui permettrait d'acquérir: un sac de riz, un sac de sel, un  sceau d'arachides un carton de sardines, un sac de spaghetti et quelques ustensiles de cuisine. Les bénéfices tirés de cette actvité lui permettront d'agrandir son retaurant, de s'en procurer un second emplacement et d'assurer la scolarisation de sa progéniture.
texts.en: Bilogui is a single 53-year-old woman who lives in a district of the capital. She is the mother of 4 children and runs a small local restaurant where she offers a variety of different meals to her customers. Thanks to her cooking skills, she has built up a growing clientèle and would like to keep her customers happy. This is why she is requesting a loan which will enable her to buy a bag of rice, a bag of salt, a bucket of groundnuts, a case of sardines, a bag of spaghetti and some kitchen utensils. The profits arising from her business will allow her to expand her restaurant, to buy a second business location and to ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, a bag of salt, a bucket of groundnuts, etc.

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en:
Restituto is a 33-year-old married man from the town of San Miguel.  He is married with three children ages 1, 3 and 4. His wife works as an auditor. He supports his family by driving a habal-habal (a motorcycle intended to carry passengers to different destinations in remote places) and also farming rice. 

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his crops and a spare tire for his motorcycle. A loan will be a great help for his business. His income will be for his children’s healthy diet. He hopes to send them to school someday and see them be successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his crops, and a spare tire

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is a sari-sari store (general store) owner from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is 42 years old and married with four children ages 3, 8, 17 and 18.  Her business has been in existence for 12 years. Her husband is a farmer and grows rice for their family.

She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise like rice, eggs, soft drinks, beef loaf (canned beef), bread, feed, milk, soy sauce, cooking oil, vinegar and shampoo. She hopes that someday she will be more successful by expanding her business and making it bigger.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like rice, eggs, soft drinks, beef loaf, bread, feed, milk, soy sauce, cooking oil, vinegar and shampoo

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 48 years old and from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with 9 children ages 11-28. Her husband is a fisherman in their town.

Cecilia has a business buying and selling fish and making dried fish for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish from fishermen that she can resell for a profit. The loan will pave the way for her to have a better income. In the future, she hopes that all her children are successful while she supports their education.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a 49-year-old woman married to a driver. She and her family live in the community of San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in rice farming and swine production.

She is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy 3 more piglets and fertilizer for her farm. She is confident that this will boost her business profitability. She hopes that someday she can expand and improve her business for bigger income. She has five children ages 8-22 that she supports through her business.

loans.use: to buy 3 more piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Dondalina

texts.en:
Dondalina is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 58 years old and has been engaged in rice production for 17 years now. She is married with one adult son, but she continues to work hard so she can buy the basic needs for her family.

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides. She hopes that someday she will be sustainable and she can reinvest her income in the same business without delay and with increased business profitability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is 58 years old and married with two grown children. She has been engaged in the fishing business for 15 years now. She and her husband helped each other to make a success out of their fishing business. However, she still encounters challenges like the limited capital for their needs. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and floaters. She hopes that through this business she can improve and be more productive, having a better profit out of hard work.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and floaters

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Asmahan prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Asmahan is a 40-year-old married woman who has four family members from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to buy blankets and clothes to resell in the same area. In the future, she wants to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy blankets and clothes to resell

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is 58 years old. She is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 and 16. She has been growing rice for 18 years now. Her husband also helps in managing their farm. 

Ernestina is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to expand her business. She will utilize her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to help in maintaining healthy crops. Her income will provide a healthy diet for her family and school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 40 years old. She is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with five children between the ages of 3 and 14. She is working to make her hog-raising business more profitable while her husband grows rice for an income. This has been her business for five years now. She is asking for a loan to buy another piglet to raise. She dreams of having a bigger piggery business someday. She also hopes that she can successfully send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy another piglet.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela is a 46-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with one daughter who is 22 years old. Manuela has been engaged in hog raising for 15 years now. She works hard on her business to make it profitable. She is asking for a loan to buy a piglet, hog feed and rice for consumption. She plans to make her piggery business bigger so that she can save enough for old age and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy a piglet, hog feed and rice

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
"My name is Ibrahim. I have a big van. I also have a smaller one that is old and needs mechanical work and a new paint job. So I've sold it and I'd like to purchase a better one in its place. I've got 25 years of experience in this business."

Ibrahim has been able to support his family of five children through his work as a van driver. He owns two vans, one which he uses to transport children to and from school (the big van, in which he is standing for the film), and the other to transport workers to their jobs in the Beqaa Valley. This year, Ibrahim made the business decision to sell his smaller van and purchase a new microbus, instead of spending more money on increasingly costly repairs.

loans.use: to help pay for a new microbus for his transportation business

loans.name: Bridgette

texts.en:
Before she entered the health care industry, two of Bridgette’s role models were already in the field. After she decided to follow in their foot steps, “I realized this was my calling and I really enjoy helping people,” she says. 

For almost four years Bridgette, a mother of five, has led her team at Abundance of Love Home Care. Located in her hometown of St. Louis, “Abundance of Love Home Care is an in-home service that assists individuals and families. We specialize in Alzheimer's and Dementia care. We are dedicated to helping our clients lead dignified, independent lifestyles in the comfort and safety of their homes by carefully assessing and fully understanding their needs, and selectively placing caring and trained personnel to meet those needs,” Bridgette says. “I have always wanted to become an entrepreneur. I always think of ways to make something better or how I can solve a problem.” 

Abundance of Love Home Care is different from other assisted living business in the St. Louis area because “we dedicate ourselves to incorporating compassion in everything we do; we genuinely care about our clients and we ensure they are comfortable. We want to change the way home care is delivered and continuously give our clients that personal experience,” Bridgette says.

Though she has not personally had a family member with the disease, Bridgette said each of her caregivers are trained on what the disease is, its stages, and how it affects the family members and patients. She says she believes there are ways to keep patients safe while allowing them “to live dignified lives for as long as they can, because there are some people who live alone with this disease,” she says. 

“Care goes beyond just feeding and bathing,” she says. “The idea is to personalize every person's care by implementing specific physical and mental activities for as long as they can perform them and provide familiarity in their everyday lives.”

Bridgette learned about Accion Texas Inc. via the Internet. She plans to use the loan to market her business and purchase technology that will make delivering care and ease communication between her employees and patient’s family members by electronically sending patient information to family members and health care professionals. “With this loan I am able to invest in technology and stay innovative in the ever-changing field of healthcare,” Bridgette says. “I can also focus on marketing to get the business known.”

She currently employs three workers and said her business “not only provides a service but more jobs in the community. I plan to hire more as the business grows. Without the loan, I would not have been able to revise the direction of my business plan in order for people to know Abundance of Love exists. This loan has allowed me to think bigger in the plans that I have. I am no longer limited because of lack of funds.”

Find out more about Bridgette’s services by visiting her website at www.abundanceoflovecare.com.

loans.use: to market her business and purchase communication devices

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 43 years old. She is from San Miguel, Bohol.  She is married to a farmer and has seven children. She is engaged in the business of buying and selling vegetables and root crops. She sells these items in the town of Talibon. 

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy more crops such as yams, taro and bananas, which she can resell for a profit. She is confident that this additional capital will promise a better return on investment. In the future, she hopes that her children will be successful through education.

loans.use: to buy more crops such as yams, taro and bananas.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a 46-year-old farmer and vegetable vendor from the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 7 and 18. Her husband is a driver who earns barely enough money for their basic needs.  

Magdalina is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to be used as additional capital so she can buy more vegetables such as taro, squash, string beans, eggplant and bitter gourd. This livelihood provides both income and food for her  family.

Magdalina hopes to be able to save money from her income so she can reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy taro, squash, string beans, eggplant and bitter gourd.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es:
Zacarias tiene 52 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la pesa y la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, asimismo su gastronomía es diversa y uno de sus platillos típicos es el riquísimo “chupe de Camarones”. Zacarias comparte su vivienda al lado de su esposa a quien quiere mucho, ya que no solo es su esposa sino una amiga y su mano derecha en todo y siempre le da ánimos para seguir adelante. Por lo general Zacarias siempre llega tarde a su casa ya que el trabaja todo el día, peo cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser ingeniero agrónomo.

Día a día Zacarias trabaja con mucho entusiasmo como agricultor  en su parcela, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque le gusta lo que hace y tiene mucho empeño.

Zacarias está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, entre otros para el cuidado de sus cultivo, de esta manera podrá tener una buena cosecha  podrá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder ser el mejor agricultor de su ciudad”.
texts.en:
Zacarías is 52 years old and lives in the city of Camaná, which is characterized by its warm and cozy weather. There are also fishing and agricultural activities, especially rice cultivation. Its gastronomy is diverse and one of its traditional dishes is the delicious "shrimp chupe".

Zacarías shares a house together with his wife who he loves a lot, not only because she is his wife, but also a friend and his right hand for everything and always cheers him up to continue progressing. Zacarías generally arrives home late because he works all day long, but when he has some free time he likes to play football with his friends and neighbors from his neighborhood. Because of the lack of economic means, he could only study up to the fifth grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to study to become an Agricultural Engineer.

Every day, Zacarías works with a lot of enthusiasm as an agricultor in his parcel. He works around ten hours per day. He thinks he does well in his business because he likes what he does and has a lot of determination.

Zacarías is very thankful to Kiva's lenders because thanks to the help they have provided him he will be able to buy compost, fertilizers and other supplies for taking care of his crop. In this way, he will be able to have a good harvest and to increase his income, which will allow him to continue struggling in order to achieve his biggest dream: "To be the best farmer in his city".

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers and other supplies.

loans.name: Abayomi

texts.en:
Abayomi has always had two passions: architecture and the environment. Growing up in Nigeria, he was always taught to have a deep respect for nature and care for the planet that has been entrusted to us. 

After immigrating to the U.S. over ten years ago, Abayomi studied public administration at Howard University, eventually transferring to the New School of Architecture in San Diego to study architectural design. Upon graduating, he worked for several different construction companies in San Diego until he was laid off during the recent economic slow down. Though a talented architect, he struggled for several months to find work and eventually had to take a position working as a security officer.

Despite his setbacks, Abayomi decided to once again pursue his passions by starting his own business. His company, Solar Leed Investments, provides consultation, installation and sales services for solar energy and green technology. Abayomi combines his love for architecture with his expertise in green energy to design energy efficient solutions to meet the energy needs of his clients.

Abayomi will use his $10,000 Kiva loan for marketing materials to acquire new clients and educate the community on the benefits of solar energy. He hopes that the success of his company will allow him to champion green energy and environmental sustainability to a broader audience.

loans.use: to pay for marketing to acquire new clients.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is a basket weaver from Antequera, Bohol, Philippines. She is 43 years old and a mother of five children.

Lorenza has been in the basket-weaving business for five years now.

Lorenza is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy buri (a native palm) to make buri baskets.

In the future, Lorenza wants to expand her business and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy buri (a native palm) to make buri baskets.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 42 years old from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with 5 children. Her eldest is 18 and her youngest is 5 years old. Marilou and her husband are engaged in a bakery and a welding shop, and also in refrigeration and television repair services. This business started 10 years ago. This is her family's main livelihood to support the needs of her children. She is asking for a loan to buy electronic tools like wrenches, screwdrivers, hammers, pliers, and also bakery ingredients like flour, sugar and margarine. These will make them more productive in their business.  The income that they will generate from these businesses will be used to buy healthy meals for her family and pay for school fees.

loans.use: to buy electronic tools like wrenches, screwdrivers, hammers, pliers, and bakery ingredients like flour, sugar and margarine.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 24 years old from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 8 months, 3 and 5. Myrna is into the selling of supplements and farming rice for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings that are necessary for her farming. The income that she will generate will allow her to earn as well as provide her family with rice for consumption.  In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm that she can cultivate for a bigger yield during harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a 58-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. For 20 years now, she has been engaged in a sari-sari store (corner store) business, and also farming and hog raising. All her six children are already adults, but Florencia works hard in order to support the needs of her family.  However, she lacks the funds for the improvement of her business. 

At this time, Florencia is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP which she will use to buy additional stock  like seasoning, toiletries and canned goods, as well as fertilizer for her farm and hog feed. 

Florencia believes that if she will be provided with financial support through the loan, she can finally be able to purchase the necessary stock for her business. In the future, through this opportunity, she hopes to improve and expand the range and scale of her business, which would eventually give her a larger amount of income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like seasoning, toiletries and canned goods, as well as fertilizer for her farm and hog feed.

loans.name: Pompia

texts.en:
Pompia is a 62-year-old mother of four children. Her eldest is 32 and the youngest is 16.  She lives in San Miguel, Bohol. She is currently involved in a hog raising business and a sari-sari (general store) business.  She works hard in her businesses hoping that they could help her sustain and meet the financial needs of her family.
 
Presently, Pompia needs additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP for her to buy additional stock like canned goods, toiletries, seasoning, chips and rice.  She is certain that through this loan, she could buy what she needs for the growth and development of her business. 

She is looking forward to a better future for her business and she hopes that one day it will turn into a bigger investment. With the income from the business, she can save for her future needs.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, toiletries, seasoning, chips and rice.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Antequera, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in a basket weaving business for several years now. This is the source of her income. Adela works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional materials to make baskets such as "buri" or native palm and others.

In the future, Adela dreams of expanding her business and making it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to make baskets.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with two children ages 15 and 21. She is 49 years old and has been engaged in a sari-sari store business (variety store) for an income for 23 years now. She is asking for a loan in order to buy stocks of rice, gasoline and soft drinks.  This is the merchandise bought by her customers in a daily basis.

She dreams of improving her business so that she can have an increased profit that will allow her to uplift her family’s living conditions. Any additional income will be used for daily family consumption, reinvestment into the same business and savings.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, gasoline and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is a 61-year-old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a widow with 8 grown children. She started operating a sari-sari store business (general store) 3 years ago.  Sabina's challenges include her limited funds to replenish her stock on time. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, feed, soft drinks, canned goods and liquor. Any additional income that she will generate will be used for daily family consumption and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy rice, feed, soft drinks, canned goods and liquor.

loans.name: Fayroz

texts.en: Fayroz is a 33-year-old married woman who has 3 family members from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She is planning on adding another room. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Nathera

texts.en:
Nathera is a 45-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan, who has four family members. 

She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to buy clothes to resell. She wants to increase her products. In the future she would like to increase her income and develop her project.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Premitiva

texts.en:
Premitiva is a basket weaver from Antequera, Bohol. She has been in this business for several years now. She is 59 years old and a mother of four grown children.

Premitiva is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 3,000 PHP to buy more materials to make baskets such as buri or native palm and others.

In the future, Premitiva wants to expand her business and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make baskets such as buri or native palm and others.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly has been engaged in a basket weaving business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. She is 40 years old and a mother of five young children. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Shirly is asking for a loan to buy more materials to make baskets such as "buri" (native palm) and nylon. In the future, she wants to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make baskets such as buri and nylon.

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en:
Ricarda is 41 years old from Antequera, Bohol. She is married with six children ages 1-20. Her husband works as a driver. Ricarda is into making baskets for an income. This business started 18 years ago. Her income helps pay for the basic household needs like electricity and school fees. 

She would like to sustain her business and she is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy raw materials like buri (native palm), rattan and nylon. She is optimistic of what hard work and dedication can do. She hopes to continue doing this business and to venture into other possible income-generating activity in the future. She also dreams of seeing her children become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like buri, rattan and nylon.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is a 44-year-old basket weaver from Antequera, Bohol. She has been in this business for several years now.
 
Lida is asking for a loan to buy materials for making baskets such as buri or native palm.
 
In the future, Lida wants to make her business more sustainable. Moreover, she wants to explore other ventures to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy materials for making baskets.

loans.name: Jemelyn

texts.en:
Jemelyn is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Antequera, Bohol. 

She is in the basket-weaving business. This is the source of her income.

Jemelyn is asking for a loan to buy materials for making baskets such as buri or native palm. With this, she will be able to make for baskets to sell in the market.

Jemelyn hopes to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for making baskets such as buri or native palm

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 30-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan, who has three family members. 

She is requesting a loan of 650 JOD to buy clothes to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same of area. She wants to expand her project. 

In the future, she would like to increase her family income and to develop her project.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Janyce

texts.en:
Janyce is a 40-year-old farmer in the Nkubu area in Kenya where she lives with her one child, who is still attending school. 

She has been in farming for the past 15 years, producing cereals that she sells at the local market in her area. She is also employed as an additional source of income.

Janyce is requesting 60,000 KES to purchase materials for a zero grazing area and animal feeds for her animals for better production. This will help her manage to pay school fees for her child and boost her living standards.

Poor markets and lack of capital and inputs are some of the challenges she is facing in production.

She says that she likes the way Juhudi Kilimo is fast in processing loans.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds and materials to build a zero grazing area.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a 58-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Antequera, Bohol. 

She has run a sari-sari or convenience store business for several years now.
 
Anastacia is in need of additional capital to buy additional merchandise such as snack foods, soap, shampoo and sodas to sell in her store.
 
Anastasia dreams of making her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store such as snack foods, soap, shampoo and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth, a 42-year-old married father of three children between 14 and 6 years of age, is a resident of Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He has been farming for 15 years and currently produces milk and poultry for the local market.

Kenneth has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chaff cutter. He is optimistic that his milk output will grow and he will be able to supply a good number of local schools and other established institutions in the area. He sees himself being able to educate his children with his farming income.

Kenneth notes fluctuation in prices and high labour costs as his major challenges. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan products, saying that they are tailored to smallhold farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.en:
Apolinar has been engaged in a basket-weaving business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income.

Apolinar is asking for a loan to buy more materials to make baskets such as buri or native palm. 

In the future, Apolinar wants to expand his business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make baskets such as buri or native palm.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been engaged in manicure and pedicure services for some time now. This is the source of her income.

Sergia is requesting a loan to buy materials for manicure treatments, such as nail polish, nail cutters and brushes, etc.

Sergia has hopes of making her business a success and plans on creating a small beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for manicure treatments, such as nail polish, nail cutters and brushes, etc.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is engaged in a food-vending business. She cooks and sells snack foods to the people in the community. She has been in the business for some time now.

Candelaria is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for cooking, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil and other items.

In the future, Candelaria wants to become successful in her business. Moreover, she wants to explore another venture to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Asunta Beatriz

texts.es:
Asunta tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y vive al lado de su esposo y de sus maravillosos hijos de 2 y 3 años a quienes ama muchísimo y por quienes da la vida con tan de verlos felices y sobre todo porque son su mayor motivo para poder salir adelante. Cuando Asunta tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear con sus hijos y sobre todo preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”. Asunta solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Día a día Asunta trabaja muy contenta en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y también alquila un auto para el servicio de taxi, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; ella cree que el va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Asunta está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar repuestos para su carro ya que presenta varias averías, asimismo comprara mercadería para su negocio de abarrotes como arroz, fideos, atún, entre otros; así el podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y poder comprarse una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Asunta is 25 years old and married.  She lives alongside her husband and her wonderful children who are 2 and 3 years old.  Asunta loves her children dearly and she does everything possible to see them happy.  They are her biggest motivation in making progress in life.  Whenever Asunta has a little free time, she really enjoys going out for walks with her children and, above all, she enjoys preparing one of her favorite dishes: chicken and rice.  Asunta was only able to study up to the fifth year of her secondary education but she would have liked to have studied to become a nurse.

Asunta works very happily each day in her business selling groceries.  She also rents a car which is used to provide a taxi service.  She works around 8 hours a day and can serve up to 15 customers a day.  She believes that she is doing well in her business because she is very friendly with her customers and has a great desire to do well in life.

Asunta is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they have provided, she will be able to buy spare parts for her car which has a number of mechanical problems.  She will also buy merchandise for her grocery business such as rice, noodles, tuna, etc.  In this way, she will be able to continue working towards making her biggest dream come true: to provide her children with a good education and to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, noodles, tuna, etc.) and spare parts

loans.name: Madelene

texts.en:
Madelene is engaged in a basket-weaving business. She is also selling coconut shells to be used as firewood. These are the sources of her income.

Madelene is asking for a loan to buy materials for basket weaving and coconut shells to sell.

In the future, Madelene wants to expand her business and explore other ventures to augment her earnings so that she could support the schooling of her two young children.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving and coconut shells for firewood

loans.name: Elen

texts.en:
Elen is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Antequera, Bohol. She is engaged in the buying and selling of personal-care products such as bio-sanitary pads/napkins. Elen has been in this business for some time now.

Elen is asking for a loan to buy more stock of personal-use products like sanitary pads/napkins to sell.

In the future, Elen wants to expand her retailing business and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal-use products like sanitary pads/napkins to sell.

loans.name: Zenon Martin

texts.es:
Zenon tiene 54 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Mala, ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura, ya que se cultivan especialmente la manzana, plátano, entre otros. Zenon es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo porque ha sacado adelante a sus 2 hijos de 16 y 27 años, ya que hace algunos  años su esposa falleció y desde ese momento el se convirtió en padre madre para sus hijos, al principio le fue difícil pero su amor de padre fue más grande. Zenon  en sus tiempos libre, los cuales son pocos, práctica música ya que tiene un pequeño grupo y en ocasiones le gusta disfrutar junto a sus hijos uno de sus platillos típicos el cual es la riquísima “Sopa Bruta y Carapulcra”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo ahorro Zenon inicio su negocio de carpintería, desde hace ya 15 años, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas, pero siempre varía de acuerdo a los trabajos que sus clientes le encarguen, diariamente puede atender hasta 5 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su negocio ya que es muy responsable con los clientes y sobre todo honrado.
